text:
FURRY FRIENDS TO SET SAIL ON THE QM2
PET lovers rejoice – the Queen Mary 2 is getting a major refurbishment and it includes making more room for pets.
The liner already carries up to 12 dogs and cats in dedicated kennels on transatlantic voyages and an extra 10 kennels will be added. A lamp post (for English dogs) and a fire hydrant (for American dogs) will be installed on the area of deck reserved for dog walking, so that dogs from either side of the Atlantic will feel equally at home.
Kennel fees for a one-week transatlantic crossing from June next year range from $US800 ($A1080) for small dogs to $US1000 for larger dogs, while for cats, which need two kennels (one for a litter tray), the cost is $US1600.
For human passengers, the 25-day dry dock refurb will also add 15 single staterooms and 30 Britannia Club balcony rooms.
Seven-night transatlantic crossings in 2016 and 2017 include a New York departure on August 9, 2016, with fares from $1539 a person, twin share, and a Southampton sailing for New York on November 19, 2016, from $1399 a person, twin-share.
Ph 13 24 41 or see cunard.com
ROCK THE BOAT IN UK
THEY have rocked the South Pacific and now Australian-owned Choose Your Cruise and partner Cruiseco are taking their music-themed cruises to the world.
For the past five years Choose Your Cruise has had major success with their rock-themed Rock The Boat cruises, country and western Cruisin Country trips and musical production Bravo cruises. They now plan to host a Rock The Boat music festival at sea out of Southampton in England, aboard the Celebrity Eclipse departing on September 30, 2016.
The inaugural Rock the Boat UK will sail from the UK to Belgium and then on to France, featuring acts including Gerry & the Pacemakers, The Searchers, Gary Puckett & the Union Gap, The Merseybeats and much more. Choose Your Cruise says it has welcomed more than 450 acts on their Australian cruises and have booked more 30,000 passengers – 40 per cent are repeat passengers. Australian music cruises are scheduled for October 2015 and November 2016.
Ph 1300 247 371 or see chooseyourcruise.com.au
SAIL THE VOLGA
HAVE a rich taste of Russia on a Volga cruise from St Petersburg to Moscow. A 10-night cruise package includes return flights from Sydney, transfers and sightseeing is available for $3499 a person, twin share, but only until July 31. The deal is for a departure on September 23, 2016, with other dates available from May to September 2016, sailing on river ship Zosima Shashkov .
Ph 1300 653 618 or see gate1travel.com.au
 A Holland America Line’s cruise is part of a highlights the Rockies and Alaska package. Source: Supplied
EXPLORE CANADA AND THE ROCKIES
JOIN an escorted tour to see highlights of the Canadian Rockies and Alaska including the Rocky Mountaineer train, Fairmont Chateau Lake Louise, Fairmont Banff Springs Hotel and Glacier Bay in 2016. Departing Australia on May 7, 2016, the 24-day package starts with three nights in Vancouver, an 11-night tour of the Rockies including two days aboard the Rocky Mountaineer and accommodation including at the Fairmont Chateau Lake Louise, then the cruise on Holland America Line. The seven-night cruise visits Glacier Bay, Skagway, Ketchikan, and Juneau. The deal including flights from Australia is priced from $13,090 a person, twin-share.
Ph 1300 764 509 or see cruiseexpress.com.au
 APT has savings on European river cruises. Source: Supplied
BE QUICK FOR SUPER DEALS
TIME is running out for the opportunity to fly to Europe for free to join an APT European river cruise in 2016.
APT’s “SuperDeal 1” savings end on July 31 with savings of up to $2500 a couple. For example, book now to travel on a 15-day Magnificent Europe river cruise from Amsterdam to Budapest on select dates in 2016 and as well as free return flights to Europe, including air taxes of up to $1100 a person, if you book and pay in full by July 31, you will save an extra $2000 a couple. The offer is valid on Magnificent Europe river cruises in category E and D cabins on departures in July and August and in all categories from October to December 2016. With the saving the cruise is priced from $6795 a person, twin-share, and travels through the Netherlands, Germany, Austria, Slovakia and Hungary.
Ph 1300 196 420 or see aptouring.com.au
SURE BET ON THE CUP
BACK a sure winner in this year’s Melbourne Cup with a cruise to the course. The eight-night cruise departs Sydney on October 30 for a round trip to Melbourne aboard the Carnival Spirit . It’s priced from $1609 a person, twin-share, in an inside cabin with $250 on-board spending money or from $2279 a person, twin-share, in a balcony cabin with $450 on-board spending money.
The special event cruise includes entry into Flemington for Melbourne Cup and Oaks Day and has a four-day port stay in Melbourne for passengers to participate in Melbourne Cup events, go shopping and explore the city’s myriad attractions. Valid for sale until August 3, 2015.
Ph 1300 450 133 or see cruiseabout.com.au
SOJOURN STARTS IN ASIA
HEAD from Hong Kong to Sydney on luxury liner Celebrity Millennium . The 32-night leisurely trip departs Hong Kong on February 28 and cruises via South-East Asia and Queensland to Sydney, priced from $4599 a person, twin-share.
This includes a one-way airfare from Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Adelaide or Perth to Hong Kong, two nights pre-cruise accommodation at the Marco Polo Hotel in Hong Kong and 30 nights aboard the Celebrity Millennium . Or take a shorter version from Singapore departing on March 13 to sail south to Sydney over 16 nights, priced from $3169 with airfare included.
Ph 1300 369 848 or see ecruising.travel
